New Records: Pete Alonso hit his fourth home run of the postseason, potentially setting a record for him or the Mets
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani and Mookie Betts opened the game with a single and double, respectively, leading to early scoring opportunities for the Dodgers.
David Peterson escaped a bases-loaded threat in the top of the first inning, preventing the Dodgers from scoring early.
Francisco Lindor and Brandon Nimmo led the Mets' offense early, with Lindor singling and Nimmo walking to set up their first runs.
Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the bottom of the first inning, igniting the Mets' offense.
The Mets scored 12 runs in total, marking a significant offensive output in the game.
Reed Garrett pitched a shutdown eighth and ninth inning, securing the win for the Mets.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets needed to bounce back after being humbled in the previous two games, facing elimination.
The article sets the context of the Mets' offensive struggles and the Dodgers' dominance in the earlier games.

The win keeps the Mets' playoff hopes alive, highlighting the importance of the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers and Mets have a day off before the next game, with the Mets planning to start Sean Manaea.
